properties.situation_snapshot:
UKHSA reported that as of 24 January 2026 there were 495 mpox (clade Ib) cases across Madagascar
with 182 confirmed. Most cases (267 total; 142 confirmed) were in Boeny region. This is an increase of 205 cases since 15 January 2026.
Travel-associated cases were also reported in Reunion and Mayotte, and four cases with travel links to Madagascar were detected in Comoros.
A first clade Ib case was reported in Czechia in a man with no recent travel history.
properties.travel_health_takeaways:
Avoid close contact with people who have mpox-like symptoms and contaminated materials.
Practise safe sex and good hand hygiene.
Consider vaccination if recommended and monitor for rash or fever after travel.

properties.location_label: Central region (Buenos Aires, Entre Ríos, Santa Fe)
properties.situation_snapshot:
Between 30 June 2025 and 10 January 2026 at least 58 confirmed hantavirus infections were reported in Argentina, including 20 deaths
(case fatality rate about 34.5%). The 2025-26 season has seen an exceedance in reported cases in the Central region (Buenos Aires, Entre Ríos and Santa Fe)
with 56 cases, surpassing the previous peak in 2019.
properties.travel_health_takeaways:
Avoid contact with rodents and their droppings by keeping food in rodent-proof containers and maintaining clean accommodation.
Do not sweep or vacuum areas with rodent infestation; instead, wet-mop surfaces.
Seek medical advice if you develop fever, muscle aches or respiratory symptoms after potential exposure.

properties.situation_snapshot:
WHO reported two laboratory-confirmed Nipah virus infections in West Bengal, India.
Both cases were healthcare workers at the same private hospital in Barasat and were confirmed on 13 January 2026.
One case remained on mechanical ventilation while the second improved.
More than 190 contacts were tested and all results were negative. No further cases have been detected.
properties.travel_health_takeaways:
Avoid contact with bats and pigs and refrain from consuming raw date palm sap.
Practise good hygiene and avoid close contact with people showing symptoms.
Healthcare workers should use appropriate personal protective equipment when caring for patients.

properties.situation_snapshot:
UKHSA reported a confirmed case of Argentine haemorrhagic fever in Santa Fe, Argentina.
The disease is endemic in Buenos Aires, Córdoba, Santa Fe and La Pampa provinces and cases typically occur during harvest season.
This is a monitored event with limited risk of international spread.
properties.travel_health_takeaways:
Avoid rodent-infested rural areas and use protective measures such as gloves and masks when handling grain or crops.
Vaccination is available in Argentina for those at high risk.
Seek prompt medical attention if you develop fever, bleeding or neurological symptoms after exposure.

properties.situation_snapshot:
WHO Western Pacific Region reported three new human cases of avian influenza A(H9N2) in China between 9 and 15 January 2026.
A 5-year-old boy from Hubei (symptom onset 30 November 2025) had exposure to backyard poultry.
An 8-year-old girl from Jiangsu and a 1-year-old boy from Guangxi developed symptoms in December 2025; both had indirect exposure to live poultry.
All three children recovered.
properties.travel_health_takeaways:
Avoid visiting live bird markets and farms and refrain from contact with birds or poultry.
Ensure poultry and eggs are thoroughly cooked before consumption.
Practise good hand hygiene and monitor for respiratory symptoms after travel.

properties.situation_snapshot:
ECDC reported that as of 5 January 2026 five new MERS cases (one fatality) were reported in Saudi Arabia, with onset between September and December 2025.
The patients were adults from Makkah (2), Riyad (2) and Najran (1); two had direct contact with camels.
Since the start of 2025, 19 MERS cases (including four deaths) have been reported, with 17 cases in Saudi Arabia and two cases imported into France.
properties.travel_health_takeaways:
Avoid contact with camels and camel products (raw milk, meat).
Practise good hand hygiene and respiratory etiquette.
People with chronic illnesses should avoid farms and markets where camels are present.

properties.situation_snapshot:
On 26 January 2026, Ethiopian authorities declared the Marburg virus disease outbreak over after 42 days with no new cases.
During the outbreak (14 November 2025 to 14 December 2025), 19 cases were reported (14 confirmed and 5 probable) with 14 deaths.
Cases occurred in four districts across South Ethiopia and Sidama regions. The outbreak remained confined and no further cases have been detected.
properties.travel_health_takeaways:
Avoid contact with bats and avoid entering caves or mines inhabited by bats.
Practice safe burial practices and avoid contact with blood or body fluids of infected individuals.
Seek immediate medical attention if you develop fever, vomiting or unexplained bleeding after exposure.
